intro: Pinalia lineata, commonly known as the lined pinyon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Central and South America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its distinctive linear leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces small, round fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a hard shell. Pinalia lineata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and vibrant floral display.
